metadata.title: CVE-2022-28805 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
singlevar in lparser.c in Lua from (including) 5.4.0 up to (excluding)5.4.4 lacks a certain luaK_exp2anyregup call, leading to a heap-basedbuffer over-read that might affect a system that compiles untrusted Luacode.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblua5.4-0 - 5.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
lua5.4 - 5.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lua5.4 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
